intro: Sagraea polychaete, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, spiky blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has silvery-gray foliage and is often found growing in coastal areas and saline soils. Sagraea polychaete is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in harsh environments.
